item.title: Morgan add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Adult librarians are like lazy bakers: their patrons want a jelly doughnut, so they give them a jelly doughnut. Children’s librarians are ambitious bakers: 'You like the jelly doughnut? I’ll get you a jelly doughnut. But you should try my cruller, too. My cruller is gonna blow your mind, kid." -- John Green

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Google can bring you back 100,000 answers. A librarian can bring you back the right one." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Walter Cronkite
item.description: "Whatever the cost of our libraries, the price is cheap compared to that of an ignorant nation." -- Walter Cronkite

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Andrew Carnegie
item.description: "A library outranks any other one thing a community can do to benefit its people. It is a never failing spring in the desert." -- Andrew Carnegie

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "I'm of the glamorous ladies At whose beckoning history shook. But you are a man, and see only my pan, So I stay at home with a book." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Zora Neale Hurston
item.description: "There are years that ask questions and years that answer." -- Zora Neale Hurston

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "You wanna fly, you got to give up the shit that weighs you down." -- Toni Morrison

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "She is a friend of my mind. She gather me, man. The pieces I am, she gather them and give them back to me in all the right order." -- Toni Morrison

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Toni Morrison
item.description: "You are your best thing" -- Toni Morrison

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Ralph Ellison
item.description: "What and how much had I lost by trying to do only what was expected of me instead of what I myself had wished to do?" -- Ralph Ellison

item.title: Morgan add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Morgan add a quote by W.E.B. DuBois
item.description: "Either America will destroy ignorance or ignorance will destroy the United States." -- W.E.B. DuBois

item.title: Morgan add a quote by W. E. B. Du Bois
item.description: "Now is the accepted time, not tomorrow, not some more convenient season. It is today that our best work can be done and not some future day or future year. It is today that we fit ourselves for the greater usefulness of tomorrow. Today is the seed time, now are the hours of work, and tomorrow comes the harvest and the playtime." -- W. E. B. Du Bois
